description.narrative: Existence of tested mechanisms for implementation of inclusive practices and trained professionals to support inclusive education in kindergartens and schools, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, boys and girls, especially the most disadvantaged, are in school and benefit from improved inclusive, gender-responsive educational policies and practices

mailing-address.narrative: 87 A. Doundukov Blvd. Fl.2 Sofia 1504 Bulgaria P.O. Box 801

sector.narrative: Capacity and skills development for social behaviour change
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

title.narrative: Bulgaria Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change
UNICEF Programmes in Bulgaria (Adolescents and young people)
UNICEF Programmes in Bulgaria (Assistance in emergencies and humanitarian crises)
UNICEF Programmes in Bulgaria (Child and Youth Participation)
UNICEF Programmes in Bulgaria (Inclusive Education and Early Learning)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Bulgaria 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Existence of tested mechanisms for implementation of inclusive practices and trained professionals to support inclusive education in kindergartens and schools

description.narrative: Modelling initiative on early inclusive education is sustained; improved quality of services in 35 kindergartens; documentation of inclusive practices is initiated; 70 representatives from the Regional Inclusive Education Support Centers were trained as trainers to roll out functional assessment in education; increased knowledge and funding opportunities for schools to apply assistive technologies in education; 276 asylum-seeking children included in recreational and non-formal learning activities which are sustained through state funding. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/12/2019

title.narrative: Percentage of teachers supporting the inclusion of children with disabilities in kindergartens and schools.

actual.value: 2019:Mid-term survey on attitudes of kindergarten teachers and their preparation for inclusive education conducted and validated

title.narrative: Pre-service and in-service teacher training includes modules on special needs and inclusion issues

baseline.value: No programs for pre-service and in-service teacher training include modules on special needs and inclusion issues

target.value: 2022:Yes, modules on special needs and inclusion issues are integrated in at least three pre-service and three in-service training programme

actual.value: 2019:Webinars on inclusive education developed and shared with pedagogical universities to be included in pre-service teacher training

title.narrative: An approach for inclusive learning environment in kindergartens and schools for all children is developed, documented and utilized to influence national inclusive policies and practices

actual.value: 2019:Inclusive practices, modelled with support from UNICEF, documented and disseminated
